name: 朴維鎮
objective:
資料和決策課程主要在介紹資訊和資料工程學，電腦推論的應用和企業決策管理等內容的設計的決策支援系統、資料抽離、資料採礦和智慧型的使用者－系統的合作系統。並利用電腦的使用來發現資料的型態，及其他任何類型的本文、影像或數字。
其目的為幫助企業經理在不確定之情況下，瞭解資料和決策分析，作出較好的決定。
The aim of this course is to learn how to make decisions as well as solve many practical problems through efficient decision-making skills and data engineering techniques. Specifically in this course we will discuss basic probability theory and its use as a basis for inferential statistics, discuss efficient decision-making techniques, and develop ability in the use of available software (e.g., R) for decision-making analysis. By the end of the course, you will understand the decision-making process, be able to use decision analysis techniques, and make better (sometimes best!) decisions systematically.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction to data analysis for decision-making
Week 2 Basic statistics Part I: Random variables, mean, median, standard deviation, variance, correlation, covariance
Week 3 Basic statistics Part II: Random variables, mean, median, standard deviation, variance, correlation, covariance 
Week 4 Basic statistics Part III: Hypothesis tests
Week 5 Basic statistics Part IV: Hypothesis tests
Week 6 Simple linear regression – Part I
Week 7 Simple linear regression – Part II
Week 8 Simple linear regression – Part III
Week 9 Interim presentation of individual project and submission of interim report
Week 10 Multiple linear regression – Part I
Week 11 Multiple linear regression – Part II
Week 12 Multiple linear regression – Part III
Week 13 Paper discussion – Part I
Week 14 Paper discussion – Part II
Week 15 Paper discussion – Part III
Week 16 Presentation I
Week 17 Presentation II
Week 18 Presentation III
scorePolicy:
1. Attendance: 10 %
2. Assignment : 30 %
3. Individual or group projects: 60 %
materials:
(1) Engineering Statistics (5th Ed., Wiley) by Montgomery, Runger, and Hubele (ISBN: 978-0-324-59433-1)
(2) Data analysis and decision making , 4th Ed. by Albright, Winston, and Zappe
(3) Introduction to Linear Regression Analysis 5th Edition by Douglas C. Montgomery, Elizabeth A. Peck, G. Geoffrey Vining
